text: Maybe a better explanation is that it is a non-subscription based MMO. It's not F2P, you have to buy the game, no subscriptions after purchase. I wished more games were like this. F2P games often have shortfalls because of their "Freemium" business model, usually along the lines of Pay for Power or Pay for Convenience lol.

text: I've been playing it casually, too.  Level 40 mesmer and a 50+ engineer.  I don't like sinking a lot of time into MMO games.  I get burnt out on them easy.  The thing I like about the Guild Wars games is that I can pick them up for half and hour and then leave and actually get something done.  I don't have to waste hours just to gain a single level like a lot of other MMO games.

author: Maxadude

text: I've been playing this game casually since its release. I'm a Norn Thief, currently lvl 55 or so and enjoying it. I'll never be able to play MMOs in a hardcore way as I did with World of Warcraft when I had a lot of free time but I'm okay with that. I smile whenever this theme starts playing while I'm exploring, it's probably my favorite so far. Jeremy Soule is gifted when it comes to composing those kind of peaceful adventuring themes.
